author: Erik V.

description: If you want value for your buck then this place is the way to go. For under 10 dollars you get such a huge portion that makes the rest of San Francisco look bad. I have a huge appetite and I come from the South (so we know how to eat), and even I could not finish the Bunny Chow. I doc the place one point because it wasn't absolutely perfect to me, but it was pretty darn good. I recommend this place for anyone who is starving and wants to spend less than $10.
author: Justin C.

description:
OMG!!! The food was soooo spicy I was perspiring during the entire lunch. I got the peri peri chicken, which is spicy chicken over a bed of vegetables and beet salad. For $10 they give you so much food, I was almost unable to finish mine. As all of my friends know, I don't give up easily and I finish everything in front of me, so this is saying how much food they give you here.
The chicken was great, definitely really spicy and perfectly paired with broccoli and cauliflower veg mix. I wish they would give me some rice with it.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Love this place.  It's a great spot in Rincon with a crazy assortment of Dutch, Indian English and African influenced cuisine.

I had the Curry Chicken Rice, while my co-workers opted for the healthier Vegetarian Quinoa Curry Rice and a Dutch inspired French Fry Stuffed Burger thing.  All came flavorful and incredibly tasty.  You would definitely like this place if you're looking for something different in the FiDi.

Try it, the two sisters who run the place are really nice!  I'm coming back for the meat pies...Can't wait...
author: Johnny W.

description: I love the unique cuisine this place offers amidst the endless sandwich shops and cafes around FiDi. I got the beef Bunny Chow which is a curry/stew inside a bread bowl. The curry itself was well flavored and had a nice spicy kick to it. The bread was soft, and the pickled carrots were quite tart but went well with everything. The portion size was good and had to work on it for a while. My only complaint is that the beef chunks were fairly dry and not very tender. I'd still love to come back and try some of the other unique things on their menu.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Amazing!

This is a great addition to the Rincon offering of restaurants.  

I tried the frikadella slap chip roll and it was out of control.  Very spicy!! Which is actually great as I love spice and most places do not make it hot enough.  NO extra hot sauce required on this sandwich.  The sauce is amazing and I love the tanginess the "chips" (french fries) add.

I will definitely check out other menu items.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
Got there during lunch rush, long line is usually good sign, so figured I'd give the african place a few of my coworkers recommended out. 

Order taking time was on the slow side, when i got to the front the cashier was too busy talking to a friend to engage me. Personal pet peeve of mine, don't hold up the line to chill with your buddy. Check time from order placed to food coming out was good, props to the kitchen. 

Got the Lemon Herb Chicken, 
The good: decently sized portions for the price. Veggies didn't appear to have been frozen, chicken was of good quality. Certainly different from other places in the food court. 
The bad: Potato side was very bland. Though the spices on the chicken and veggies were interesting at first, everything was seasoned the same so after a bit it didn't feel like there was any variety in the dish. 

Bottom line: probably will try it again for it's uniqueness compared to surrounding places but it didn't impress the first time out.
author: Erik H.

description: Really strange ingredient pairings make for strange flavors.  Definitely did not enjoy my meal although I did eat more than half of it.  Since I ate half I suppose 3/5 stars is fair.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Pros - 
- Great place to get quick lunch. 
- Very flavorful food. 

Cons - 
- I don't think the food is prepared onsite. 
- Rincon Center can get very busy during lunch, so it's hard to find seating. 

My vote is for is the cape malay quinoa with beans.
author: Paddy N.

description: Generous portion and friendly staff. Definitely check this place out if you want to remember the good food of South Africa. Wish they would expand their menu though! Come here for lunch.
author: G C.

description:
Great curries!  I had the roti, which was an amazing wrap filled with a fresh saucy chicken curry.  GREAT flavors and the roti breading was really nice as well.  Today they had meat pies on display which I have no doubt are insanely good, I really wanted to take one for the walk back to the office, but that would have ruined the day.

My buddy had this meatball sandwich which was really good too, very herbal meat, super fresh and tasty with vinegar fries.  These fries are nothing like you are used to, they call them "slop" in Africa.  They tasted like vinegar onions and added a nice contrast to the meat.

This place is in a quiet corner of the Rincon Center, but if you use the door closest to Mission, you can't miss them.  I'm really looking forward to my next visit, great addition to the FD.
author: Jon S.

description:
Good food, good portion sizes, long wait. It took a pretty long time to get out food; I came at 12:40 and it took over 30 minutes to order and get my food, but it's really flavorful food and you get a lot for what you pay for. The bowl of quinoa I got had to be over a pound. The dish was quinoa spiced with curry and had a good mix of vegetables, broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, and some starchy one that seemed like a potato, but I wasn't quite sure.. It's a little spicy, which I really liked, but if sriracha is too spicy for you, then this might not be good to order. It was also pretty heavy(not just physically) given that it was only quinoa and veggies, so if you're looking for a light, simple lunch, this might not be the best. 

The bowl had enough food for 2 meals. You could definitely eat the whole thing in one sitting, but it's just enough to make you regret finishing it. The guy at the register has a cool accent and is quite a character. He takes his time and likes to make conversation. He was convinced he'd seen my friend somewhere else and it made my friend a bit uncomfortable because he just kept staring. But other than that very friendly!
author: Maleenee B.

description: I had a pretty nice sandwich from here.  I was a bit disappointed they had no real sides, also they were sold out of pies.  The food is a little slow here, but mine was worth the wait.
author: Michael E.

description: The cape malay rice with chicken was delicious and just the right amount of spice.  I plan on going back and trying more of the menu.
author: John B.

description:
The place is pretty new and sort of hidden in the Rincon food court. They have a nice staff and EVERYTHING I've had so far was really good, especially the Frikadella roll and Vetkoek. I still have a couple more items to go through on the menu ( there's only like 5 items right now) but I have a feeling they won't disappoint. 

I will give them 5 stars.. as much as I would like to keep this place a secret, it won't be fair to give them anything less. I am a happy customer.
author: Don Z.

description:
Amawele is in the back corner of the Rincon center, opposite Yank Sing. 

Decent food. I ordered the Cape Malay rice with Bobotie (fruit & spicy beef). Good rice to meat ratio. The bobotie wasn't very spicy but they did have hot sauce on the side.

Definitely wouldn't crave Amawele but it's a decent lunch option if you're looking for something besides salad and sandwiches.
author: CL S.

description:
Come here for a fun, reasonably priced, lunchtime culinary adventure in the Financial District!  I can't verify how authentic the food here is, but I will say that it is truly delicious and definitely worth a try.  The Cape Malay Quinoa with Bobotie (sweet fruity spicy ground beef) was super flavorful, snot-inducingly spicy and very satisfying.  The quinoa was also loaded with veggies like eggplant, beans, corn, peas, carrots, and cauliflower, making it possible for me to believe that the food is also good for me.  I also had a bite of the frikadella roll and that was delicious as well.

Depending on how big of an appetite you have, you might even have enough for another meal.  They start running out of stuff around 1pm, but with so many great options on the menu, it shouldn't be hard to find something else to try.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Amy C.

description:
If you get here at 11:59 am, right before the 12 o'clock rush you will be fine. The food here is unique and I would definitely recommend the Frikadella as its the best sandwich to have. Its a little bit spicy but its manageable. 

Do not get the chicken curry wrap. Its pretty much curry chicken wrapped in a tortilla with some carrots. This wrap is not worth your time when you have the Frikadella on the menu.
author: Ryan C.

description: It was just ok.. a lot more european than I expected. Meat was rather dry.
author: Julie R.

description:
To start, they're really friendly and nice.  It's clear the food is done well and with love.  I ordered the Chicken Roti and it's a really substantial lunch.  If I were a construction worker I'd be really happy.  Everyone in our group said the portions were huge, we all tasted one another's items and everyone liked what they tasted.  

My roti felt like it weighed at least a pound and half.  It was spicy and the heat continued to build as I ate.  I left 3/4 of the roti because I simply could not eat it all. I'm sure for cold weather, this will be a lunch to warm you up and really qualify as rib-sticking food.  I'd love to come back, but, the meals all are extremely carb heavy and just heavy.  I'm sure I'd be comatose now if I'd eaten the entire roti.  I give them props for the huge portions and reasonable prices.  

Anyway, I'm all for new exciting flavors and this was fitting that bill.
author: Donna H.

description: Thanks YELPERs,  the food was great.   Still not clear on what makes up S African cuisine, but the Chicken Bunny was delightful as raved (What is this Bunny reference?  maybe bun?)  more like a 1/4 loaf of bread.    the biggest bread bowl I ever had.   My colleague tried the Cape Malay Quinoa....  delicious!  It was hard to find at first all tucked into a corner.  If not for me LOOKING for the place I would have been easily swayed to one of the many other culinary choices.  think Mall food court but much better.
author: Thad L.

description: Had the beef bunny chow today at lunch for the first time, it was delicious! Not to mention filling.  Amaweles is a must try eatery especially if you frequent the financial district.
author: Jd D.

description:
A co-worker of mine first tipped me off to Amawele's. She was having their Sweet Potato Curry with Beet Salad, which is super colorful and would attract anyone's eyes.

In the past week, I have gone twice for lunch. My first time, I ordered their roti Chicken Curry Wrap, which is delicious. Many reviews mention the level of spicy-ness and heat for this dish, but do not fear! It's nothing too crazy and the yumminess makes up for it. I was actually able to add a little of the house hot sauce to my wrap, which definitely took the experience to a whole new level. 

I then got the Sweet Potato Curry with Beet Salad. I have to say, the curry is pretty good but could definitely benefit from the house hot sauce. The beet salad is delicious. The beets are pickled which makes them delightfully tangy.

Amawele's has delicious food, awesome and generous servings, and super affordable prices.
author: Ana M.

description:
The first time I walked by, the lines seemed long and I heard someone looking at he display case say the portions looked small. Not true. I've never waited more than five minutes for my food, and the portions have always been filling.

I'm a vegan, so I just get the Durban Roti Wrap with butter beans or the Cape Malay rice or quinoa with vegetables. The degree of heat is just right, with the Cape Malay being a little spicier. I usually get the wrap because I like the sauce the beans are cooked in. I'm not as used to eating drier dishes like the Cape Malay rice, but the taste is addictive and I always finish it. The food that I have tried is probably about a 3 on the 1-5 heat scale used by some restaurants.

The staff are all very nice and work very hard to please their customers.
author: Brad G.

description: Had Amawele's delivered into the office from Cater2me, super delicious! Recommend trying the chicken curry with Durban wrap on the side with the mashed potatoes. Nom Nom! Vegetarian co-worker had their Lima bean curry with Duran wrap, said was tasty too. Haven't been in the actual restaurant, definitely plan to check them out.
author: Nicole B.

description: I had the chicken bunny chow and it was good.  BUT, Honestly I was disappointed with the bread.   The bunny chow is served inside a square bread bowl and it was basically a bowl of wonderbread.  Really plain, white bread.   Dish is very filling so be hungry if you order this.  Also, give yourself time - lunch time is busy so expect to wait 10 min to order and 10 more for your food.
author: R. G.

description: Went today at 12:30, the line wasn't bad,, took a while to get our order but worth the wait! Different, flavorful, tasty, spicy, yum!
author: Teresa B.

description: A refreshing change of pace from the other derivative sheeple-feeders in the Rincon Food Court. Give it a go. But, be prepared for the peri-peri. Got a nice tang to it. Not for the faint-hearted.
author: John H.

description: They recommended the Durban Chicken Wrap as a first-timer, which they said was one of their most popular items.   For $7.50, I received a hefty roll with lots of chicken, potatoes, curry, and pickled veggies.  The wrap was delicious and very filling...sweet roti wrapper, spicy curry (good heat, but not overly spicy), and tart pickled veggies.  It's a great balance of flavor.   It's definitely a must-order the next time I'm in the area.
author: Ring K.

description: Amawele's is the best lunch spot that i have found here.. Got here just before noon and had the bunny chow and boy did it hit the spot!! Definitely coming back to clean up the menu
author: Nav N.

description: I always get the Veggie Roti Wrap. It has butter beans, potatoes, carrot slices, and curry. It's delicious and has a good spice kick to it. The meal is very filling! I like my foods spicy so I always ask for extra of their homemade hot sauce. The gentleman who works there is always so polite and does more than just take your order. He makes my visit feel personal, and special by getting to know me. They also have free complimentary juice that they make. It's very good. Reminds me of water infused with fruit, but with more flavor.
author: Naomi S.

description: I recently discovered this shop hidden in the corner of Rincon center.  What at first glance appears to be a drink stand, I soon found to be my new favorite lunchtime go-to spot!  Day one was a generous portion of the tasty Rabbit Chow.  Tasty curry in a large chunk of bread.  I followed up the taste adventure the very next day with the Frikadella Slap Chip Roll, a tasty sandwich which seems to be a South African equivalent of an "all-in-one".  The dutch style meatballs are well balanced with the vinegary chips, and the orange sauce completes the awesomeness!
author: David S.

description:
this place is great, the owners really do their best to make the food and the experience first class.  

the portions are big but the food is healthy

I go here allot for lunch.
author: Patrick H.

description: The duran wraps = life-changing. Everything else is great too, but man... those wraps!
author: Eva G.

description: Grubbed on the chicken wrap the other day. Chicken breast cubes, lettuce and potatoes in a nondescript yellow curry sauce. The whole deal was wrapped up in a roti- not as flaky as the Indian varietals unfortunately. Overall good value in the FiDi for a quick bite but flavors were nothing to bring me back.
author: Anthony R.

description: Hot, spicy and tangy!! We had the Frikadella sandwich (carb heaven) and the paleo peri-peri chicken with steamed vegetables and pickled beets. My only criticism is that the chicken was dry, therefore I'd recommend dark meat or gently stewing the white meat to maintain the tenderness. I loved it all, especially on a rainy cold SF afternoon. Some may find it too tangy and spicy. Seems fairly authentic from my perspective. Inexpensive, huge portions and HOT!!
author: R L.

description:
Amazing food!

I attended a friend's birthday party that was catered by Amawele's. They provided burgers and some side dishes. The two sisters were awesome and grilled the best burgers I've ever had. I would recommend them to anyone!
author: Steven B.

description:
I love this place so much. I could eat here every day.

The people are super nice, the hot sauce is hot, and the roti is awesome. Extra points for having vegan roti.

There can sometimes be quite a line at lunchtime, but that's typical for the area. Go early since sometimes they run out of some things.
author: Wade A.

description: Totally unique - such a hidden surprise in Rincon.  I have had the Frikadella, the Cape Malay Rice, and the Bunny Chow.  All good, but the Cape Malay is my favorite - something about that beef, veggie, and rice combo that has so much flavor.  Reasonably priced and they don't skimp on portions either.  Owners are using serving when I have been there and they are super cool nice girls.
author: Brian F.

description: As part of Rincon Center, it can be easily missed for some of the other options.  It's a nice change of pace from the other lunch places.  I had the Bunny chow chicken as well as a Wednesday vegetarian pie special.  The curry in the chicken is quite spicy and tasty.  The bread was quite voluminous and soaked up a good amount of curry and helped out with the spiciness.  You have to take your time as it is quite temperature hot.  The pie crust was quite flaky and the sauce was solid with all of the roasted vegetables.  The food is more like 5 stars.  My main issue is that for being only a lunch place, the portions are a little big.  With the pervading curry scent and taste, it's not the easiest to enjoy at your work desk, and all of your co-workers know you've been here.  I think if they made a lunch portion at a lower price and kept their full size as it is, it would definitely be a step in the right direction.  The staff was nice and it's got a good location off of the Spear street entrance so I'd definitely come back to try additional food.
author: Jay N.

description: I'm multitasking while eating their food and dabbing the sweat from my forehead (its Spicy!!). My colleague recommended this place so we went to try it out. This food is absolutely delicious!!! The spices and flavors explode (literally) in your mouth!! It is how I wish my at-home cooking could be!! I must warn you it is a bit spicy. OK, its VERY spicy. I'm eating it and I have the fan blowing against my face at the same time. Any who, the cashier was very pleasant and helped me pick it a great dish. I'm in love and on fire (mouth still burning). They offer a variety of dishes including a curry chicken dish which I hear is amazing (and spicy). I decided on the Peri Peri Chicken. It looks like it was cooked in hell it it taste like heaven (just have milk, water or a fire extinguisher nearby). Check it out. I'll be making many more stops here and will definitely let my friends ho work nearby about this joint.
author: Jermaine J.

description: Favorite new lunch spot. If you like spicy food this is a place to check out. It's quickly becoming popular and the lines are getting longer but the food is worth the wait. Very filling with lots of vegetables the different dishes are all worth trying.
author: Ron B.

description: This was my first experience with South African food. I absolutely loved it! You get a ton of food for a very reasonable price. Definitely will return.
author: Mike P.

description: Amawele's was my first try at South African food. I got the Vegetarian Frikka Roll and it was amazing. I loved the sauces and the flavors in it. They have small boxes of Hot Sauce, which are good as well. I'd go back here for lunch any day.
author: Sabareesh K.

description: I really want to like this place more because their menu offering is so different.  However, having had the vegetarian roti and the peri peri chicken on different occasions, I can't enthusiastically endorse them as I can barely taste the seasonings and food over the ridicuolous amount of salt they use.  Maybe that is traditional for S. Africa?
author: shannone e.

description: When I want to feel like I'm eating a home cooked meal for lunch I know where to go.  Amaweles. They truly serve home cooking from the South African kitchen.  My favorite is the lemon herb chicken. Fresh and flavorful every time. Portions fill you up and you'll have some leftover for an evening delight.
author: Chau N.

description: Food is delicious and the portions are super filing!  I like the South African hot sauce and I am thinking of buying a bottle.  There are paleo options now, for those interested parties.  Pot pies are also delicious, although I enjoy the vegetarian pot pie more than the chicken pot pie.
author: Anna L.

description:
I had the Chicken Roti and it was mediocre at best.  The roti was sweet, the chicken was OK, the potatoes weren't exactly tasty. 

My friend had the Paleo Chicken and it was pretty much chicken, brocolli, cauliflower, and beets (all presteamed) mixed up with hot sauce and then microwaved for 3 minutes.

I've always been disappointed by Rincon 101 and this hasn't changed my opinion.
author: Davve B.

description: Very earnest and sincere, smiley service and interesting, unique food - just be warned it's very spicy and heavy! A nice and different lunch choice from the usual FiDi selection.
author: Sonya Z.

description: The smell of this place brought me to its counter and my choice of the paleo chicken curry with pickled beets (which is curry chicken over broccoli, carrots and cauliflower) was tasty.  Would I go again, YES.  I'm looking forward to trying other dishes on the menu that look really tasty as well.
author: Beverly B.

description: Tucked in the far left corner of Rincon Kitchen is this delicious place. THe food is a mix of Afrikan, Indian and British cusine. I had hte butter bean roti wrap which was spicy, sweet and tangy all at once. THe food wakes up your taste buds and you can tell a lot of car and love was put into their cooking. Will def be back for lunch again soon!
author: Hetal S.

description:
I also missed the Bunny Chow, since they were out. Wondered what rabbit tastes like. ;)
Anyway, what I did have, the Frikadella Slap Chip Roll, was fantastic. Looked a bit like a gyro (or maybe a gyro looks like a Slap Chip Roll.) But it was great. A bit spicy, but not overly so. Yumm!
author: Herbert S.

description: in a fairly inconspicuous Mail building- good food, though a bit on the spicy side if you are not careful. The pineapple water was a bonus, have to try more items of the menu
author: Shantanu V.

description: Ridiculously good food and great service, plus extremely convenient if you work in the financial district. Very authentic!
author: Heather B.

description: Amazing South Africa dishes. Such nice people and genuine South African owners. I know as I have been to South Africa before and it's like visiting Cape Town again!
author: Helen M.

description: Their Chicken Roti wrap is delicious!! I suggest BYOB with your food. :)
author: Dee N.

description: Had the peri peri chicken paleo dish and it is suuuuuper spicy! There was one person ahead of me and the wait was pretty long for being microwaved. I may give them another shot, the rice and wraps look good.
author: N. L.

description: Love that they have Paleo options. The Peri Peri chicken is delicious and spicy, served on a bed of vegetables with a yummy beet salad. A large portion (2 meals worth for me) at a reasonable price. Will definitely go back and try other dishes.
author: V. R.

description: I had a chicken roti that was okay. The orange water was a nice touch.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Salad was great; chicken curry was even better. Frikadillas (sp*?) are def worth trying as well
author: Tristan S.

description: Had the chicken masala pie - because, as warned on FB, they were sold out of the bobotie pie.  Delicious and filling.  A steal with the Groupon I had, but still a great value at $6.50/pie.
author: B. Y.

description: Delicious, nice to have a paleo option in FiDi that isn't a salad.  Tried the Bobtie today and looking forward to going back and trying others.
author: Jeff E.

description: A few coworkers and I tried Amawele's today for the first time. We meant to get there early but didn't end up getting there until around 12:30 - there was a bit of a line but we managed to get our food in about 20 minutes.  Things are pretty normally priced - about $8-$9. I got to try the Frikadella roll and the LAST bunny chow. Both were really good -  tons of flavor! The girls are also super nice, overall a win for a FiDi lunch. If I worked closer, I would definitely come here very frequently.
author: Christine H.

description: Kinda hard to find - it's inside the one Rincon center. There are a lot of great ethnic food places in here to chose from. I ordered the chicken bunny chow. But everything on the menu looks great. A lot of people ordered the sandwiches, and those orders come out faster. My order took over 15 minutes because they gave it to someone who had ordered after me in error. The owner was very apologetic. The curry is very tasty, spicy and just a tad on the salty side. It had potatoes, onion, chicken and maybe green peppers in it. There is a red hot sauce you can eat with it on the side. I love spicy food and I liked the addition of the red sauce, but there's enough heat in the curry, you don't need it. Portion size is generous. No way I could finish it. I liked it just fine and if I lived here would order it again. Be sure to grab the free water, it's sweet and refreshing against the heat of the curry.
author: Shelley C.

description: Sinus clearing! Wow! The Piri Piri Paleo box did the trick for my cold. Pickles are awesome and help tame the heat. I only wish there were some sweet potatoes in here to temper it a bit more. Vegetables are great, but it gets a little watery at there bottom.
author: Ashley M.

description: This place blew my mind!!  Large portions of extremely delicious food at very good prices.  I didn't have any reference for food from South Africa going in, but I fear I am now going to have cravings way to often.  Their Bunny Chow (a chicken and potato curry in a hollowed out loaf of South African bread) is to die for!!  I can't wait to go back and have again.  I also had the Slap Chip Sandwich - a meatball patty with succulent and spicy sauces and South African "chips" (french fries) served on a hearty roll that I would recommend to anyone looking for a creative and kickass take on the American burger.  I can't say enough good things about Amaweles - if you like spicy food and work or live near the Embarcadero/Financial District, you have to check this place out!!!
author: Terence G.

description: I ordered the frikadella roll and it was good: spicy, soft bread, lots of flavor. It took about 15 minutes total: waiting in line, ordering and getting food.
author: Gee H.

description: I'm South African and it's a little bit of home every time I go there. The owners always have a welcoming smile and keen for a quick SA chat.
author: Paul D.

description: Fantastic! Food from home!! Ten stars. To anyone who writes a bad review or can't handle spicy food. Stick to bland. Pan era and Starbucks will always be there for you.
author: Kim K.

description: I was searching for a new place that serves paleo friendly dishes, and I found Amawele's on Yelp!  I was excited to try the peri-peri chicken being a lover of beets and spicy food, and it did not disappoint.  The chicken is very spicy, even by my standards, and I loved it!  Great flavor, although could be considered slightly tart due to all of the hot sauce.  The beet salad was refreshing and the veggies were a nice addition.  I gave it minus one star because the restaurant was a bit difficult to find, and the menu is not self explanatory (unless you look at the display case which does not have all of the items).  I'm also not sure if I received a 1, 1.5, or 2 sized dish...I think it must have been 2 since it is enough for 2 meals.  I would say, however, just choose anything and it is probably delicious.  I will be back soon for the sweet potato curry or the other paleo beef dish.  Looking forward to it.
author: Nick T.

description: Well this was delicious.  I went on a whim and was happy I did so!  I had their slap chip and it was spicy and lovely.  My friend had the sweet potato curry thing, which was also delicious.  I will warn that they mean the spicy, but it's not just heat-actually had spices involved in the spicy!  The food court vibe is not my favorite, but this place is worth going to.
author: Paul W.

description: Delicious! Got the beef and rice because everything else was sold out. It was the best surprise dish I've ever had. Didn't have a clue what it would be and it ended up just being all these new yet familiar blends of tastes and spices in my mouth. Definitely go here!!!!!! At the back left corner of the Rincon 2. Also, the workers are super nice!!
author: Alexander M.

description: Great option if you are on the Paleo diet.  Also good sized portions.  Service is super-slow at lunch as it seems they are understaffed.
author: Erik K.

description: Unique lunch spot with some of the best and most interesting flavors available. The Roti chicken wrap was excellent; the unlimited sauce served alongside it elevated the dish to the next level.
author: James H.

description: Great meat pies! The chicken curry one was delicious and flavorful. I agree that it's the best option in Rincon Center as well. The frikadela roll was recommended by the owner, but I actually thought the meat pie was better. Can't wait to go back!
author: Jeanne C.

description: We had company catering from this place the food was excellent . I wish they are open on weekends or a actual restaurant.  will come back for sure
author: icee a.

description: A coworker came back from Amawele's with a little pot of hot sauce that was so delicious (it had the perfect balance of vinegar, heat and spice) that I needed to go and try the food for myself.  I ordered the Frikadella wrap and it has said hot sauce, although it was tempered down into an aioli, and it was good.  In the wrap, you get two meatballs, that were ok although a little gamey, vinegar doused french fries which were delicious, a few lettuce leaves, and a generous dousing of the hot sauce aioli. The wrap itself is dense and a little sweet. First bit was pleasing but halfway through my mouth was on fire (I should let you know that I generally order mild or medium heat when eating out). The cashier was funny as he repeated my name at least half a dozen times to ensure he got the right pronunciation and the portion was decent.  Price was a little on the higher side for what you get but the hot sauce was complimentary (not that you need more of it if you order the Frikadella) as was the sweetened water.
author: C L.

description: My experience with Amawele's South African Kitchen has been one of the best in SF. If you are the type of person who enjoys the experience of an explosion of flavors in your mouth, this is definitely the place for you! They use bold spices and ingredients that honor authentic South African food, so what you are getting is for sure the real deal! If you go crazy about spicy food this is the place to go. Bunny Chow would be the way to go for having an spicy experience. For those who are taking care of their diet, the paleo meals are a great option. I personally like the chicken curry wrap, it has the perfect combination of flavors, it is not spicy and it is filling. I really like the wrap, which is called roti, NOT tortilla. Me being Hispanic, means that I know what a tortilla is and they are both very different. Roti is a traditional flat bread that complements many dishes in South African cuisine. It is usually handmade, rolled and cut into perfect circles. Amawele's roti have a some sweetness that adds an extra special touch to the chicken curry wrap. So, please do yourself a favor and go to Amaweles's South African Kitchen and have a meal experience that you will never forget!
author: Liri Q.
